meanings.definition: Harmful or unfavorable conditions or circumstances
meanings.sent1: The town faced many ills such as poverty and pollution.
meanings.sent2: Despite the ills of the world, she remained hopeful.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the ills of modern society.
meanings.sent4: The ills of corruption spread like a contagious disease.
meanings.sent5: The ills of neglect were evident in the abandoned house.

meanings.definition: Suffering or distress caused by sickness or injury
meanings.sent1: He was bedridden due to the ills of a severe flu.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed medication to alleviate her ills.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ills, he managed to crack a joke and make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ills of a broken heart can take time to heal.
meanings.sent5: The ills of a twisted ankle made walking difficult.

meanings.definition: Wrong or evil actions or motives
meanings.sent1: The detective uncovered the ills of the criminal mastermind.
meanings.sent2: She was shocked by the ills committed by her trusted friend.
meanings.sent3: The fairy tale warned children about the ills of greed.
meanings.sent4: The ills of jealousy can poison relationships.
meanings.sent5: The ills of betrayal left a deep scar on her heart.
